15.heading: The Lost Children of the World.
15.title: "Freak Show"
15.author: written by Bruce Jones ; illustrated by Berni Wrightson ; colored by Michelle Wrightson
15.appears_in: p. 11-16 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 6 (Sept. 1982).
notes: "The story so far: A brightly decorated wagon pulled into a small town at the height of a severe rain storm. The driver, a gaunt figure in black, began to tell the townspeople of a similar person who, years earlier, undertook the 'collecting' of lonely and deformed people, the lost children of the world."
To be continued.

16.heading: Lost Cities.
16.title: Atlantis, the Lost Empire [videorecording]
16.author: Walt Disney Pictures ; producer, Don Hahn ; screenplay, Tab Murphy ; directors, Gary Trousdale, Kirk Wise.

publication info.publisher: Distributed by Buena Vista Home Entertainment

notes: 1 videodisc (96 min.) : sd., col. ; 4 3/4 in.
DVD.
Closed-captioned.
Summary (from OCLC): Hidden deep below the ocean surface is one of the greatest mysteries of all time

the Lost City of Atlantis. Join the world's most highly qualified crew of experts led by "adventure capitalist" Commander Rourke and Milo Thatch, a linguist who knows the ancient Atlantean language, as they board the incredible 1,000-foot submarine, the Ulysses, and head deep into the mysteries of the sea, hoping to reveal the secrets of Atlantis.

17.heading: Lost Cities.
17.title: Atlantis, the Lost Empire : the Junior Novelization
17.author: adapted by Lara Bergen ; based upon the screenplay written by Tab Murphy.
notes: "With 8 pages of full-color movie stills!"

Summary "At last, Milo Thatch's lifelong dream is coming true! He is setting off to find the lost city of Atlantis as a member of a secret expedition. Milo and his crewmates are about to discover that the legendary civilization is not only real, but still exists!"
At head of title : Disney's.
